source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: California’s Businesses
summary: Most California businesses are small, and most Californians are employed by small businesses. Well-established businesses are responsible for most jobs, but job growth is stronger among new businesses. Business ownership does not mirror California’s demographic makeup.

title: “Queríamos encontrar nuevos amigos”: Las personas mayores de California demuestran que el aislamiento no es inevitable
summary: Los centros para personas mayores de Los Ángeles se están recuperando de los cierres por la COVID-19 y ofrecen nuevos programas para adultos mayores. Vea cómo cambió la vida de los participantes desde la pandemia.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Self-Employment in California
summary: Self-employment is an important contributor to California’s economy; about 2.2 million Californians are self-employed, and the jobs they create account for 23% of total employment. Self-employment varies widely across demographic groups, and it is prevalent in both high- and low-wage occupations.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Who Are California’s Workers?
summary: Californians work in a variety of occupations and sectors, and wages vary widely across regions and demographic groups. The median full-time, year-round worker in California earns about $31 an hour; over a third of California workers have low-wage jobs, which pay less than $21 per hour.

title: San Diego teachers cancel strike as deadline neared; district to address demands over special education
summary: San Diego teachers canceled their planned Feb. 26 strike after reaching a tentative agreement with the San Diego Unified School District to increase special education staffing, provide additional teacher support and stipends, and secure future pay raises pending restoration of state funding.

title: Finding Purpose and Home: How VA helped homeless Veteran rebuild
summary:
While experiencing homelessness, Marine Veteran William Barber felt he had lost his willingness to help others. 

With support from VA and a place to call his own, he rediscovered his purpose, and is now helping others again.

If you are a Veteran who is homeless or at imminent risk of homelessness, we strongly encourage you to contact the National Call Center for Homeless Veterans at (877) 4AID-VET (877-424-3838) for assistance.

For more information, visit https://www.va.gov/HOMELESS/

title: You Won't Believe How Dems Just Contradicted Themselves on Venezuela
summary:
You Won't Believe How Dems Just Contradicted Themselves on Venezuela

In this episode, I discuss the apparent inconsistencies and hypocrisy among elected Democrat officials concerning the removal and prosecution of Venezuela's former president, Nicholas Maduro. I highlight several instances where Democrats criticized President Trump's handling of the Maduro regime, only to later oppose similar actions when executed. We should unify not argue for consistent application of the rule of law and American interests, regardless of political affiliation.

summary:
COLUMBUS, Ohio – Concerned Veterans for America (CVA) praised Senator Jon Husted for introducing the Rural Veterans Improved Access to Benefits Act, legislation that strengthens health care and benefits access for veterans, particularly those in rural and underserved Ohio communities. The bill ensures permanent, cross-state access to certified providers for required disability compensation exams, expands the […]

title: Onboard USS Makin Island, 13th MEU and PHIBRON 7 Strengthen Navy-Marine Corps Integration During Amphibious Training
summary: The Navy-Marine Corps team has concluded Quarterly Underway Amphibious Readiness Training (QUART) 26.2, which took place from Jan. 20-30, 2026. The exercise, led by the 13th Marine Expeditionary Unit (MEU) and Amphibious Squadron (PHIBRON) 7, featured the Wasp-class amphibious assault ship USS Makin Island (LHD 8), which expanded the training's ability to prepare MEUs and Amphibious Ready Groups (ARGs) for future deployments and operations afloat. Further strengthening international partnerships, Peruvian naval officers were aboard to observe the exercise, fostering shared learning and military cooperation.

title: Minnesota's Conspiracy Exposed: Don Lemon's Role?
summary:
Minnesota's Conspiracy Exposed: Don Lemon's Role?

Join us on Minneapolis as we delve into the rapidly escalating conflict between federal ICE operations and coordinated local resistance. In this episode, we explore the contentious involvement of figures like Don Lemon. With revelations from infiltrated chat groups, we expose the deep ties between Democratic officials and anti-ICE activists, uncovering allegations of conspiracy and federal law violations. Featuring insights from various sources and ongoing investigations, this episode provides a penetrating look at modern-day 'resistance' movements and the legal ramifications for those involved.

title: State Policymakers Discuss Priorities, Challenges for 2026
summary: Affordability is a top issue for policymakers from both parties, along with AI and immigration. Heath Flora, Republican leader of the California State Assembly, and Democratic Assemblymember José Luis Solache, Jr., discuss their concerns with PPIC president and CEO Tani Cantil-Sakauye.

source: The Official United States Marine Corps Public Website News
title: 2nd Marine Logistics Group 3D printed Drone
summary: Sgt. Henry David Volpe, an automotive maintenance technician with 2nd Marine Logistics Group, has successfully developed HANX, the Marine Corps’ first NDAA-compliant, 3D-printed drone platform. Developed at the II MEF Innovation Campus in just 90 days, the HANX drone represents a major leap in tactical manufacturing by providing a low-cost, modular system that is resilient against adversary software. By utilizing 3D printing and off-the-shelf parts that meet rigorous security standards, Sgt. Volpe and his team have moved drone production from external contractors directly into the hands of Marines. This "by Marines, for Marines" innovation aligns with the Department of War’s "Drone Dominance" initiative, offering a versatile tool for reconnaissance or one-way attack missions that can be built and modified anywhere in the fleet.

title: Don Lemon's Wild Church Hijack: KKK Act in Play?
summary:
Has Don Lemon turned church crasher? Explore the allegations of First Amendment abuses as we dig into a narrative where law meets disorder.

Let’s not mince words: are elected officials in Los Angeles County more committed to sanctuary than security? Discover the blurring lines between state responsibility and federal authority, and brace yourself for a dive into a chaotic legal landscape where even the Ku Klux Klan Act is dusted off for action.
